greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle A103451 * A007318 * A000012, read by rows. T(n, k) for 0 <= k <= n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = A103451(n,k) * A007318(n,k) * A000012(n,k) as infinite lower triangular matrices.
T(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..n} binomial(n, k+j), with T(0,0) = 1 and T(n,0) = 2^n + 1. - _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
T(n, k) = binomial(n, k)*hypergeom([1, k-n], [k+1], -1) - binomial(n, k+n+1)* hypergeom([1, k+1], [k+n+2], -1) + 0^k - 0^n. - _Peter Luschny_, Nov 20 2019
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= T[n, k] = If[k==n==0, 1, If[k==0, 2^n +1, Sum[Binomial[n, k + j], {j, 0, n}]]]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==0 && n==0, 1, if(k==0, 2^n +1, sum(j=0, n, binomial(n, k+j)) )); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
if k eq 0 and n eq 0 then return 1;
end if; return T; end function;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
else: return sum(binomial(n, k+j) for j in (0..n))
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 23 2007
